DataElementConcept.preferredName: Clinical Blood Increase Viscosity Syndrome Present
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Relating to the examination and treatment of patients dependent on direct observation.  The term may also refer to the institution (clinic) providing this activity._A liquid tissue; its major function is to transport oxygen throughout the body. It also supplies the tissues with nutrients, removes waste products, and contains various components of the immune system defending the body against infection. Several hormones also travel in the blood._A process of becoming larger, more numerous, more important, or more likely._The resistance of a liquid to sheer forces and flow._a set of symptoms, usually three or more, which occur together and characterize a particular pathological state; for thorough searching see the Permuted Term Index for specific syndromes._Being or existing in a specified place or at the specified time.

Concepts.definition: Relating to the examination and treatment of patients dependent on direct observation.  The term may also refer to the institution (clinic) providing this activity.

A liquid tissue; its major function is to transport oxygen throughout the body. It also supplies the tissues with nutrients, removes waste products, and contains various components of the immune system defending the body against infection. Several hormones also travel in the blood.
A process of becoming larger, more numerous, more important, or more likely.
The resistance of a liquid to sheer forces and flow.
A group of signs, symptoms, and clinicopathological characteristics that may or may not have a genetic basis and collectively define an abnormal condition.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Specification of human conditions relevant to cancer. This includes observations, test results, history, and other concepts relevant to characterization of human cancer-related conditions. Non-neoplastic conditions of interest are also included.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Bleeding or escape of blood from a vessel.: Used to indicate that either or both of two items or options may be valid.: Injury of the soft tissues or bone without breaking the skin that is characterized by blood leakage into the surrounding area.

Concepts.definition: The flow of blood from a ruptured blood vessel.
Used to indicate that either or both of two items or options may be valid.
Injury of the soft tissues or bone without breaking the skin that is characterized by blood leakage into the surrounding area.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Dizziness is a medically indistinct term used to describe a variety of conditions such as lightheadedness, unsteadiness, giddiness, a sense of turning, spinning or rocking.

Concepts.definition: A sensation of lightheadedness, unsteadiness, turning, spinning or rocking.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Overall tiredness and lack of energy.

Concepts.definition: Overall tiredness and lack of energy.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.
